title: full screen issue
body:
i dont know if any one have same problems ...
before patch 7.1 everything was perfect with my pc about full screen and fps was awesome now i cant play about 14 days 
when i play in widowed mood the fps drooping down to 20 -_- before patch 7.1 was 70 and no lag  
cuz that issue i connect with riot support and thy give me useless steps and i do everything thy told me for nothing  
if any one can help me pls

replies.body: I looked into this for you and do see that you have a ticket currently open, and a specialist working with you directly on this.  The steps requested are asking for logs which will help us get context on your specific issue.  Without that information, we'd be grasping at straws so it would be in your best interest to get that over to him.  If you like, you can use our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to automatically grab those logs.  I hope that helps!

i send for him every thing dude and i download HRT for him for nothing 

and that the final answer i copped for you 

  Hello friend,

My colleagues were not around so I dropped by to assist you further.

I am sorry to have to be the bearer of bad news but after my colleagues tried everything to make things work I must let you know that there's not much more we can help you with.

Due to the recent bugs we've had concerning performance and due to the fact that your setup is below the recommended system specifications our best bet would be to wait until a fix is rolled out by the dev team.

Minimum and recommended system requirements:
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654

We can't effectively support any hardware that isn't also supported by that hardware's manufacturer. It's generally up to the manufacturer to make sure its hardware stays up-to-date on any software changes that may occur during the hardware's lifetime. League is no exception--there is inevitably a feature that clashes with an old hardware's ability to run the game. The game may still function to a limited extent on that hardware, but we can't guarantee it.

Sadly I don't know when this fix will be out and I am unhappy with this response myself but I had to be honest with you, there's not much more to be done.
